official-title.#text:
To promote transportation-oriented development and
		  encourage dedicated revenue sources for urban and regional rail corridor
		  development.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
National High Performance Passenger
			 Rail Transportation-Oriented Development Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(in this
			 Act referred to as the

quote.#tail:
) shall establish an initiative
			 to promote intercity and urban passenger rail operations and
			 transportation-oriented development by creating incentives for communities to
			 encourage dedicated revenue sources for urban and regional rail corridor
			 development.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall obtain the services of qualified
			 independent private sector entity with experience in transportation-oriented
			 development to serve as a liaison between the Federal Government, State and
			 local authorities, private sector participants, and appropriate other
			 stakeholders in the initiative. Such entity shall—

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of
			 enactment of this Act, the

provide
			 recommendations as requested by the Secretary, which shall include
			 recommendations on—

types of projects
			 that should receive incentives under the initiative; and

mechanisms for
			 providing technical assistance and types of technical assistance that should be
			 provided; and

conduct a
			 preliminary transportation-oriented development survey on the Northeast
			 Corridor or other local station areas or regional corridors.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall harmonize planning requirements and direct coordination and
			 administration of the initiative between the
and the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish criteria for the designation of projects qualified
			 for Federal incentives pursuant to this section and the amendments made by this
			 section.

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Types of
			 projects that may qualify

text.#text:
Projects that may qualify for Federal
			 incentives pursuant to this section and the amendments made by this section are
			 commercial development or other projects that—

contribute to the
			 generation of revenue by the capture of increasing value from development
			 around station areas, through the establishment of special assessment
			 districts, increasing the tax base, promoting job growth, promoting cost
			 effectiveness, facilitating intermodal connectivity, combining congestion
			 relief with station development, stimulating economic development, or any other
			 appropriate means;

are likely to make
			 long-term contributions to rail corridor development funds or similar
			 mechanisms that help finance intercity and urban passenger rail infrastructure
			 or operating expenses; and

provide for a
			 quantifiable revenue stream to the relevant station or rail operation.

An
			 applicant for Federal incentives pursuant to this section and the amendments
			 made by this section shall be a State, local, or regional authority. Such
			 authority shall provide for coordination among stakeholders, local governments,
			 and private developers in the defined region, and shall be the lead party in
			 the application.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, projects are not authorized to receive Federal incentives
			 pursuant to this section and the amendments made by this section until the date
			 that is 1 year after the report required under

text.#text: In general, Federal applications to the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide technical assistance to applicants and potential
			 applicants for Federal incentives pursuant to this Act and the amendments made

text.#text: The

identification of
			 transportation-oriented development opportunities;

establishment of
			 special assessment districts in regions;

establishment of
			 rail corridor development funds; and

expediting
			 Federal, State, and local regulatory approvals.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide technical

, including—

text.#text: The

header.#text:
States,

text.#text:
technical
			 assistance on the establishment of regional authorities appropriate to carrying
			 out the purposes of this Act at the regional level; and

technical assistance at the request of a
			 State, local, or regional entity to identify stations and potential stations
			 within a region and conduct a preliminary survey of property available and
			 potentially available, to maximize development and commercial revenue
			 generation to financially support the development of a high performance
			 intercity or urban rail passenger corridor.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
